column16: Askari (Eritrean) troops firing cannon.

Italian officer coaxing a half-nude African woman into a hut. The title translates as "secret service."
Italian child (from Dopolavoro, an Italan fascist recreational club) pushing an African child on a swing.

column16: Four steriotypical imaged Africans on a bicycle.

Italian baby soldiers breaking the chains of African babies. In the background  is a sign by General De Bono with a note to the people of Tigray. Includes postmark, stamp, address and writing.
Italian baby soldiers expelling African baby traditional leaders from the land.
Uniformed Italian children handing out clean, white clothes to African children, one of which holds an Italian flag. Title translates as "delivery kit." Includes postmark, stamp, address and writing.
Italian soldiers rrunning towards four African women, in varied states of undress, primping by a river.

column16: Italian baby soldiers holding an Italian flag and an African baby holding a white flag, while giving the fascist salute.

The king of Ethiopia withdawing from the kingdom. Title trarnslates as "the withdrawal of the king."

column16: An Italian officer following an African woman.

column1: Il Negus lascia la sua residenza al fronte. Ma quella non la prendi? Sai bene che mi e' indispensabile!
column16: African king complaining about his wife leaving his crown in the hut.
African villagers ignoring a call from a  drummer.

A six panel cartoon depicting soldiers preparing Molotov cocktails to blow up an advancing tank - they succeed. Includes postmark, address, and writing.
In honor of Italian General Orlando Lorenzini, who was killed in action at Keren, Eritrea in 1941. He was awarded the Gold Medal of Valor.  Lorenzini fighting on the battlefied.
In honor of Italian Captain Antonio Cavalleri who was killed in action and awarded a Gold Medal.  Cavalleri in battle shooting a rifle.
In honor of Luciano Gavazzi, who was killed in action during a battle in Uolchefit, Ethiopia. He was awarded a Gold Medal.  Gavazzi in the midst of the battle.
